title: Alberta Stroke Program Early CT Score (ASPECTS)
description: Quantifies early ischemic changes in MCA territory on non-contrast CT to predict stroke outcome and guide treatment decisions

parameters.name: caudate
parameters.description: Caudate nucleus - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: lentiform
parameters.description: Lentiform nucleus - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: internal_capsule
parameters.description: Internal capsule - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: insular_ribbon
parameters.description: Insular ribbon/cortex - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: m1
parameters.description: M1 - Anterior MCA cortex (frontal operculum) - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: m2
parameters.description: M2 - MCA cortex lateral to insular ribbon (anterior temporal) - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: m3
parameters.description: M3 - Posterior MCA cortex (posterior temporal) - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: m4
parameters.description: M4 - Anterior MCA cortex superior to M1 - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: m5
parameters.description: M5 - Lateral MCA cortex superior to M2 - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

parameters.name: m6
parameters.description: M6 - Posterior MCA cortex superior to M3 - focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation

ranges.interpretation: ASPECTS 0-4: Extensive MCA territory infarction. Very poor prognosis. High risk of symptomatic hemorrhage with thrombolysis. Consider palliative care discussions.
ASPECTS 5-7: Large MCA territory infarction. Poor functional outcome likely. High risk (14%) of symptomatic ICH with IV thrombolysis. Mechanical thrombectomy may still be considered if ASPECTS ≥6.
ASPECTS 8-10: Limited early ischemic changes. Good candidate for reperfusion therapy. Lower risk of symptomatic hemorrhage. Greater benefit from IV thrombolysis expected.

references: Barber PA, Demchuk AM, Zhang J, Buchan AM. Validity and reliability of a quantitative computed tomography score in predicting outcome of hyperacute stroke before thrombolytic therapy. ASPECTS Study Group. Alberta Stroke Programme Early CT Score. Lancet. 2000;355(9216):1670-4.
Pexman JH, Barber PA, Hill MD, et al. Use of the Alberta Stroke Program Early CT Score (ASPECTS) for assessing CT scans in patients with acute stroke. AJNR Am J Neuroradiol. 2001;22(8):1534-42.
Goyal M, Demchuk AM, Menon BK, et al. Randomized assessment of rapid endovascular treatment of ischemic stroke. N Engl J Med. 2015;372(11):1019-30.
formula: Start with 10 points. Subtract 1 point for each region with focal edema or parenchymal hypoattenuation: Caudate, Lentiform, Internal Capsule, Insular ribbon, M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, M6
notes: ASPECTS score ranges from 0-10 points (10 = normal, 0 = extensive infarction)
Evaluated on two standardized axial CT cuts: basal ganglia level and supraganglionic level
Subtract 1 point for each region with ≥1/3 area involvement
Score ≤7 predicts poor functional outcome and increased hemorrhage risk
Score ≥8 indicates good candidates for IV thrombolysis
Score ≥6 may be considered for mechanical thrombectomy
Correlates inversely with NIHSS score and stroke severity
Predicts 3-month functional outcome and symptomatic ICH risk
Used in major stroke trials (ESCAPE, SWIFT-PRIME) for patient selection
Requires assessment of all axial cuts, not just two standardized levels
Should be used with clinical assessment and other imaging findings
Interrater reliability is good with proper training
